title: Why does ghost not activate a character's running animation?
body: I have Sion's mecha sion skin, and only get to see his jetpacks used very rarely throughout the game, despite using ghost in almost every match .1820 skin should activate his jetpacks, instead of speedrunning.

replies.body: Because you have to reach a certain speed in order to activate the running animations.
Actually, isn't it based entirely around Homeguards? They're certainly referred to as Homeguard animations.
Sometimes you see people enter their haste animations from Youmuu's or Lulu's W

I think any kind of MS buff boost should activate running animation, so that these animations don't feel useless waste of time on some champions (similar to crit animations) and it might provide more clarity.

I realize though that it may be distracting for some people and become pain in ass in team with many MS buffs. Then there are cases like Deadman's where you have to decide whether that champion would be permarunning or just at certain threshold.

Maybe not _any_ kind of MS buff or even any kind of MS buff that pushes a champion past a certain threshold, but it seems fair that a lot more buffs are tagged to use the animation.

Should be reserved for buffs that create high moments, like Righteous Glory, Talisman of Ascension, On the Hunt, etc. Though while Whimsy can certainly act that way, it'd probably be funnier for it to keep the hyperspeed walking, fitting for such a whimsical spell.

Ghost is delayed, it takes a second to spin it up. For the 1st second of ghost activation there is very little meaningful movement speed increase. It's the unit passthrough that matters at that point. So do you wanna see a running animation move really slow or a walking animation suddenly move fast?

You have to reach a certain MS threshold in order to activate those animations. So that means Ghost in early levels without any additional MS does not pass it. So no Homeguard animations for you!
